title: Petition: Do not remove LGBT content from the Relationships Education curriculum

last_post.content:
Please sign if you are a UK citizen or resident & boost if you are not.

This obsessed woman is on the point of giving up. There were only 50 new signatures yesterday, the lowest daily increase in the last 30 days.

As I write there are 92,866 signatures on the petition. The most optimistic ETA for 100,000 signatures is now Wednesday 17 May in 79 days time.

The last thing we want is the petition to *remove* LGBT content from the curriculum to be debated and our opinion not to be heard.

May I thank each & every one of the amazing people that that have boosted this message an extraordinary 3,444 times.
💖 💖 ❤️ ❤️ ❤️

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/631529

Please consider signing this petition regarding trans dignity in death:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/633194

#TransRightsAreHumanRights #TransPetition

title: The retention problem: Women are going into tech but are also being driven out

last_post.content:
“Women make up only 9.8% of the people who contribute to open-source software projects. . . . our research found that women’s negative experiences range from minor to severe harassment, sexism, discrimination and misogyny to explicit death threats. Their expertise is challenged, their contributions are not well-received and their roles are diminished.” - Vandana Singh

https://theconversation.com/the-retention-problem-women-are-going-into-tech-but-are-also-being-driven-out-200625
#OpenSource #WomenInTech

title: They thought loved ones were calling for help. It was an AI scam.

last_post.content:
RT @pranshuverma_
new: AI voice-cloning tech is making phone scams frighteningly believable.

I talked to some who got duped. They were elderly + heard their loved one needed cash now. They felt it might be a scam, but the voice sounded too real to ignore.

One lost $21k.

https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2023/03/05/ai-voice-scam/

title: Haraldur Þorleifsson Sweeps Person of the Year Awards

last_post.content:
Haraldur "Halli" Þorleifsson is the employee Elon is currently making fun of on Twitter. He has muscular dystrophy.

He's won multiple Person of the Year awards from Icelandic media outlets for his efforts to build wheelchair ramps across the country and his charitable givings during the holidays.

When his design firm Ueno was acquired by Twitter in 2021, he opted to be paid the sale price through wages rather than receiving stock that would be taxed at the much lower capital gains tax rate.

His employment contract wasn't that of a typical employee, nor is his termination. Twitter now owes him the entirety of his outstanding sale payment.

https://www.icelandreview.com/news/haraldur-thorleifsson-sweeps-person-of-the-year-awards/

#Twitter #ElonMusk #Musk #HaraldurÞorleifsson #Þorleifsson #Halli #Iceland #Tech #Ueno #Employment #Contracts #Ableism #Discrimination

title: Stochastic Parrots Day

last_post.content:
Join us on March 17th for Stochastic Parrots Day marking the 2nd anniversary of the paper. The authors will be joined by scientists, teachers, writers, artists, legal scholars & data workers to discuss the large language model landscape.
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/stochastic-parrots-day-tickets-524219965027

Here's the agenda of the event
with Angelina McMillan-Major, @meg @emilymbender with @timnitGebru @milamiceli @asme @Riedl @safiyanoble @nanjala Steven Zapata, Sarah Andrew, Belzie Mont-Louis and an anonymous data worker.

title: ‘Slavery was wrong’ and 5 other things some educators won’t teach anymore

last_post.content:
#USA #Censorship: "Excerpts from Mary Wollstonecraft’s “A Vindication of the Rights of Woman.” Passages from Christopher Columbus’s journal describing his brutal treatment of Indigenous peoples. A data set on the New York Police Department’s use of force, analyzed by race.

These are among the items teachers have nixed from their lesson plans this school year and last, as they face pressure from parents worried about political indoctrination and administrators wary of controversy, as well as a spate of new state laws restricting education on race, gender and LGBTQ issues.

“I felt very bleak,” said Lisa Childers, an Arkansas teacher who was forced by an assistant principal, for reasons never stated, into yanking Wollstonecraft’s famous 1792 polemic from her high school English class in 2021.

The quiet censorship comes as debates over whether and how to instruct children about race, racism, U.S. history, gender identity and sexuality inflame politics and consume the nation."

https://www.washingtonpost.com/education/2023/03/06/slavery-was-wrong-5-other-things-educators-wont-teach-anymore/

title: pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.2208...

last_post.content:
🚨New Pub at PNAS🚨! We know people cannot detect language written by AI. But what makes them THINK text was AI-generated? We show that people have consistent heuristics... that are flawed & can be exploited by AI to create text "more human than human" 🧵

https://www.pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.2208839120

(apologies, rare cross-posting from Twitter -- in fact, rare posting on Twitter altogether).

I got laid off yesterday. We'll be ok, but it still sucks. Tough time to be on the market.

I'm giving myself space this week, but applied to a role yesterday 🤞🏻

Looking for roles in open source as a senior IC, management in a larger org, or nonprofit leadership. I'm most known for partnerships, community building, nonprofit operations, and program management, and I hold my own in compliance and media relations. :boost_requested:

title: Signal is for everyone, and everyone is different

last_post.content:
There is no such thing as a global norm. Infrastructure varies, as do culture and communications expectations. For Signal to be a globally useful alternative to surveillance tech, we need to perform well and offer relevant features, even if this means very different things in different contexts.

https://signal.org/blog/signal-is-for-everyone/

title: https://visdeurbel.nl

last_post.content:
#BREAKING: the Fish Doorbell is LIVE! 🐟 🛎️

Fish migrate down Utrecht's waterways every spring, but the lock is rarely opened then. Hence, the "fish doorbell". If you spot fish on this literal live stream, you can send a photo to the lock-keeper to alert them to open the gates!

Migration really gets going in April, so stay tuned.

https://visdeurbel.nl

title: Why time is running out to restore animals existing only in captivity to the wild

last_post.content:
For species perched on the brink, extinction looms—yet recovery is achievable. And while conservation biologists have the tools for success, they need support to deliver it.

title: https://neverworkintheory.org/

last_post.content:
Ubuntu, today, has a "gender-normalized IQ test" - phrenology with paperwork, basically - in their hiring process.

If someone explained they find bugs in their code by pointing a dowsing rod at the screen you might have questions, but if you're "doing agile" you might have more in common with bug-dowser-guy than you realize.

I organize a conference on evidence-based practices in software engineering. It's called Never Work In Theory; you should go. https://neverworkintheory.org/

title: Revealed: 1,000 super-emitting methane leaks risk triggering climate tipping points

last_post.content:
"More than 1,000 “super-emitter” sites gushed the potent greenhouse gas methane into the global atmosphere in 2022"

Hard to know what the most shocking part of this story is, but just the idea that 25% of current warming is from methane and **40%** of that methane is from entirely avoidable fossil fuel facility leaks is horrifying. https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/mar/06/revealed-1000-super-emitting-methane-leaks-risk-triggering-climate-tipping-points #methane #climate #fossilfuels

title: https://youtu.be/fYFruezJEDs

last_post.content:
Someone finally did a study based on data from GitHub PRs that measures how it is that teams that do continuous code review (either #pairprogramming or #mobprogramming) are somewhat counterintuitively able to perform so much better than those doing asynchronous code reviews (pull requests). Lotsa queuing theory but it boils down to ensemble programmers having zero interruptions & remaining in a flow state. https://youtu.be/fYFruezJEDs

(Also the psychological safety advantage is huge in my XP ☺️)

title: relx.com/investors/annual-repo...

last_post.content:
#Elsevier profit is up! Now a margin of more than 37%:

https://www.relx.com/investors/annual-reports/2022

The similarly profitable RELX surveillance section ("risk") is tightly coupled, which makes it impossible to know how much of Elsevier's revenue comes from publishing their 600k articles and how much from their 'data analytics' activities. Assuming all surveillance revenue is counted in the 'risk' section, the average Elsevier article is priced at US$5846 with a profit of US$2211.

title: How often do all of the planets repeat their exact positions? For example, how often would the planets be just as they were on any given ...

last_post.content: I was thinking maybe 467 years, but turns out the answer to this question is “Never.” The solar system is not on a cycle and does not repeat itself. https://www.quora.com/How-often-do-all-of-the-planets-repeat-their-exact-positions-For-example-how-often-would-the-planets-be-just-as-they-were-on-any-given-date-time-like-a-birthday-or-historic-event

• Data Augmentation via fuzzing & generation
• Cascade pattern to split problems into smaller pieces

What else?

title: PaLM-E: An Embodied Multimodal Language Model

last_post.content:
PALM-E, Code as Policies, SayCan and similar are all very exciting progress in general reasoning for robotics, but they still depend on low level primitives (goto and pick/place).

How do we get to general reasoning with tight visuomotor control?

Wonder if we could get the high level reasoning models trained to just spit out weights for a 'policy network' or something...

https://palm-e.github.io/

title: Fear of "negative consequences": faculty committee that denounced UA's response to deadly, on-campus shooting disbands early

last_post.content:
What?
https://news.azpm.org/p/newsc/2023/3/5/215136-fear-of-negative-consequences-faculty-committee-that-denounced-uas-response-to-deadly-on-campus-shooting-disbands-early/

* A 2022 campus shooting at U of Arizona causes the death of a faculty member.
* University creates a committee to investigate.
* Committee's interim report finds some deficiencies in campus security.
* University spokeperson criticizes the report.
* Committee members fear reprisals and lay down the committee.

@academicchatter

title: What Our Tech Ethics Crisis Says About the State of Computer Science Education

last_post.content:
Another point I strongly agree with (raised by David Danks) is that the goal of embedding ethics content isn’t to turn all CS students into ethicists - but to teach them enough that they at least know how to spot issues and seek out more expertise when needed.

Conversations around Cambridge Analytica solidified this idea for me that ethics shouldn’t be just a specialization, but also a specialization, see metaphor here about safety engineers: https://cfiesler.medium.com/what-our-tech-ethics-crisis-says-about-the-state-of-computer-science-education-a6a5544e1da6

A cartoonishly evil, wealthy oaf, versus a charismatic entrepreneur of working class origins, beloved by his countrymen for generosity and civic-mindedness in his success

title: TLDEF - Support Us - Transgender Legal Defense And Education Fund, Inc.

last_post.content:
March is my birthday month.

I am fifty years old, which is sort of a big deal. And I almost died in surgery twice last year.

I know what I want for my birthday month.

I want y'all to donate to the Trans Legal Defense and Education Fund, or some other trans support and defense group of your choice, in honor of Shelia Sexton, aka Escapade.

If you do that and you could just let me know you did, maybe send me a screenshot, I would love that very much.

https://www.tldef.org/support-us/

title: New filter: author retains all rights

last_post.content:
Kudos to the Directory of Open Access Journals (@DOAJ) for this important new feature.
https://blog.doaj.org/2023/03/07/new-filter-author-retains-all-rights/

"Earlier today, we released an update to our #search interface to provide users with an author retains all rights filter.

There are 7154 journals in DOAJ where the author pays no fees and retains all rights.

There are 3400 journals in DOAJ where the author pays no fees, retains all rights and the content is licensed with a CC BY license."

#OpenAccess #RightsRetention #Diamond
